content.text: THIS PURCHASE AND SALE AGREEMENT (“Agreement”), dated for reference purposes as of ____________, 20__, is made by and between ________________________, a _________________________ (“Seller”), and UNICO INVESTMENT GROUP LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“Buyer”).  As used herein, “Effective Date” means the date of mutual execution of this Agreement established by the dates shown below each of the signatures of Seller and Buyer.
content.caption: THIS PURCHASE AND SALE AGREEMENT (“Agreement”), dated for reference purposes as of ____________, 20__, is made by and between ________________________, a _________________________ (“Seller”), and UNICO INVESTMENT GROUP LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“Buyer”).

content.text: 1.	KEY BUSINESS TERMS
content.caption: KEY BUSINESS TERMS

content.text: 1.10	“Property” means: (a) the land legally described on Exhibit A attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference (“Land”); (b) the building located on the Land commonly known as the __________ Building with a street address of _________________ (“Building”) and any other improvements, structures and fixtures presently located on the Land (together with the Building, “Improvements”); (c) any and all tangible personal property (if any) located on the Land or within the Improvements and owned by Seller, including without limitation the personal property expressly identified on Exhibit B attached hereto (“Tangible Personal Property”); (d) to the extent owned or controlled by Seller, all rights, privileges, interests, licenses, claims, easements, benefits, covenants, conditions and servitudes of any type or nature which are appurtenant to or otherwise benefiting the Land or Improvements, whether existing or after acquired, including all minerals, oil, gas and other hydrocarbon substances on the Land or Improvements, as well as all development rights, air rights, water, water rights and water stock relating to the Land or Improvements, and any other easements, rights of way or appurtenances owned by Seller and used in connection with the beneficial operation, use and enjoyment of the Land or Improvements, all rights of Seller, if any, in and to streets, sidewalks, alleys, gores, strips, driveways, parking areas and areas adjacent thereto or used in connection therewith, and all rights of Seller, if any, in any property lying in the bed of any street adjacent to the Land (“Appurtenances”); (e) to the extent assignable, all licenses, permits, approvals, certificates of occupancy, dedications, subdivision maps and entitlements issued, approved or granted by any governmental entity or public utility in connection with the Land or Improvements, together with all renewals and modifications thereof (“Licenses and Permits”); (f) all of Seller’s interest in any as-built plans, drawings and specifications for the Improvements and all architectural, structural, mechanical, electrical and landscaping plans and specifications, surveys, engineering studies and reports relating to the Land or Improvements, if any, owned by Seller and in Seller’s possession or control (“Plans”); (g) to the extent owned by Seller and to the extent assignable: any warranties or guarantees received by Seller from any contractors, subcontractors, suppliers or materialmen in connection with any construction, repairs or alterations of the Land or Improvements and all of Seller’s interest in and to any URLs, web addresses, websites, trademarks and trade names, including without limitation “________ Building” used solely in connection with the Land or Improvements, if any (“Intangible Personal Property” and, together with the Tangible Personal Property, the Licenses and Permits, and the Plans, the “Personal Property”); (h) all unexpired leases, subleases, occupancy agreements, parking leases, and any other agreements, if any, for the use, possession, or occupancy of any portion of the Land or Improvements as of the Closing Date, together with any guaranties thereof (each, a “Lease”); and (i) all Assumed Contracts (as defined in Section 8.2 below).
content.caption: “Property” means: (a) the land legally described on Exhibit...

content.text: 1.15	Responsibility for Broker Commissions.  Seller shall pay any commissions or fees due or payable to Seller’s Broker pursuant to a separate agreement with Seller’s Broker.  ________ shall pay any commissions or fees due or payable to Buyer’s Broker pursuant to a separate agreement with Buyer’s Broker.
content.caption: Responsibility for Broker Commissions.

content.text: 2.	PURCHASE AND SALE
content.caption: PURCHASE AND SALE

content.text: 2.1	Agreement to Purchase and Sell.  Subject to the terms and conditions stated herein, Seller agrees to sell, transfer and assign to Buyer, and Buyer agrees to purchase, assume and accept all of Seller’s right, title and interest in and to the Property.
content.caption: Agreement to Purchase and Sell.

content.text: 2.2	AS-IS, WHERE-IS.  THE TRANSACTION CONTEMPLATED BY THIS AGREEMENT HAS BEEN NEGOTIATED BETWEEN SELLER AND BUYER.  THIS AGREEMENT REFLECTS THE MUTUAL AGREEMENT OF SELLER AND BUYER AND BUYER IS RESPONSIBLE FOR CONDUCTING ITS OWN INDEPENDENT EXAMINATION OF THE PROPERTY.  OTHER THAN SELLER’S REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT OR IN THE DOCUMENTS TO BE DELIVERED BY SELLER AT CLOSING (“CLOSING DOCUMENTS”), BUYER HAS NOT RELIED UPON AND WILL NOT RELY UPON, EITHER DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY, ANY REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY OF SELLER OR ANY OF SELLER’S AGENTS OR REPRESENTATIVES.  OTHER THAN SELLER’S REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT OR IN THE CLOSING DOCUMENTS, SELLER SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIMS, AND NEITHER IT NOR ANY OTHER PERSON IS MAKING ANY REPRESENTATION, WARRANTY OR ASSURANCE WHATSOEVER TO BUYER AND NO WARRANTIES OR REPRESENTATIONS OF ANY KIND OR CHARACTER, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, ARE MADE BY SELLER OR RELIED UPON BY BUYER WITH RESPECT TO THE PROPERTY INCLUDING STATUS OF TITLE TO OR THE MAINTENANCE, REPAIR, CONDITION, DESIGN OR MARKETABILITY OF THE PROPERTY, OR ANY PORTION THEREOF, IT BEING THE EXPRESS INTENTION OF SELLER AND BUYER THAT, EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT, UPON BUYER’S ELECTION TO PROCEED WITH THE TRANSACTION AS PROVIDED FOR IN THIS AGREEMENT, THE PROPERTY WILL BE CONVEYED AND TRANSFERRED TO BUYER IN ITS PRESENT CONDITION AND STATE OF REPAIR, “AS IS” AND “WHERE IS”, WITH ALL FAULTS.
content.caption: AS-IS, WHERE-IS.

content.text: 2.3	Earnest Money Deposit.  Within 2 Business Days, as defined in Section 16.2 below, after the Effective Date, Buyer shall deposit with Escrow Agent via wire transfer the Earnest Money Deposit in immediately available funds.  All sums constituting the Earnest Money Deposit shall be non-refundable if Buyer delivers the Buyer Approval Notice pursuant to Section 3.2, except as otherwise expressly provided in this Agreement.  The Earnest Money Deposit shall be held in an interest-bearing account provided that both parties execute any authorizations required by Escrow Agent to invest the funds.  All interest earned on the Earnest Money Deposit while in escrow shall become part of the Earnest Money Deposit and paid to the party entitled to the Earnest Money Deposit.
content.caption: Earnest Money Deposit.

content.text: 2.4	Independent Consideration.  Seller and Buyer agree that $100 of the Earnest Money Deposit (“Independent Contract Consideration”) shall be non-refundable and shall be paid to Seller immediately upon request by Seller.  The Independent Contract Consideration has been bargained for and agreed to as additional consideration for Seller’s execution and delivery of this Agreement.  At Closing, the Independent Contract Consideration shall be applied to the Purchase Price.  If this Agreement is terminated for any reason, notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, Seller shall be entitled to retain the Independent Contract Consideration.
content.caption: Independent Consideration.

content.text: 2.5	Payment of Purchase Price.  At Closing, Buyer shall pay to Seller the Purchase Price as follows:
content.caption: Payment of Purchase Price.

content.text: 2.5.1	The Earnest Money Deposit shall be credited against the Purchase Price and shall be released by Escrow Agent to Seller upon Closing.
content.caption: The Earnest Money Deposit shall be credited against the Purc...

section_hierarchy.caption: The Earnest Money Deposit shall be credited against the Purc...

content.text: [OPTIONAL TEXT: 2.5.	The then-outstanding principal amount of the Existing Loan, as defined in Section 2.6.1, being assumed by Buyer at Closing pursuant to Section 2.6 below shall be credited against the Purchase Price.]
content.caption: [OPTIONAL TEXT: 2.

content.text: 2.5.2	Buyer shall pay Seller the balance of the Purchase Price in immediately available funds at Closing.
content.caption: Buyer shall pay Seller the balance of the Purchase Price in...

section_hierarchy.caption: Buyer shall pay Seller the balance of the Purchase Price in...

content.text: [OPTIONAL TEXT: 2.6	Assumption of Existing Loan.
content.caption: [OPTIONAL TEXT: 2.

content.text: 2.6.1	Existing Loan and Assumption Contingency.  Buyer agrees to acquire the Property only if it may pay a portion of the Purchase Price by assuming all outstanding indebtedness under the existing loan (“Existing Loan”) evidenced by that certain promissory note dated as of ______________, executed by Seller in favor of ________________________ (“Existing Lender”), in the original principal amount of $___________ (“Note”).  Therefore, it shall be a condition precedent to the obligation to close for both Seller and Buyer that Seller and Buyer shall have received an Existing Loan Assumption Approval (as defined in Section 2.6.6 below).
content.caption: Existing Loan and Assumption Contingency.

content.text: 2.6.2	Responsibility for Applying for Loan Assumption Approval.  Promptly following delivery of the Buyer Approval Notice, as defined in Section 3.2, Buyer shall request approval from Existing Lender to assume the Existing Loan, and, with the assistance and cooperation of Seller, commence and use good faith efforts to complete the process necessary to permit Buyer to assume (pursuant to documents reasonably acceptable to Buyer) the Existing Loan at Closing, including, without limitation, Existing Lender’s underwriting and approval of Buyer [and its proposed replacement guarantors or indemnitors] for assumption of the Existing Loan, negotiation and finalization of assumption documentation, and negotiation of any required opinion letters. In furtherance thereof, Buyer shall provide to Existing Lender all necessary financial, historical, legal or other documentation as may reasonably be required by Existing Lender in connection with such assumption.
content.caption: Responsibility for Applying for Loan Assumption Approval.

section_hierarchy.caption: Responsibility for Applying for Loan Assumption Approval.

content.text: 2.6.3	Loan Assumption Costs.  ______________ shall pay any legal fees of Existing Lender and other costs payable to Existing Lender in connection with the assignment and assumption of the Existing Loan and any assumption or other fees payable to Existing Lender in connection with Buyer’s assumption of the Existing Loan; provided that each of Buyer and Seller shall pay their own respective attorneys' fees.
content.caption: Loan Assumption Costs.

content.text: 2.6.4	Existing Loan Assumption Documents. Buyer shall keep Seller apprised as to Buyer's progress in processing such assumption, and shall provide to Seller copies of draft Existing Loan Assumption Documents when received by Buyer. In the event that Buyer and Existing Lender agree prior to the Closing Date, in their respective sole and absolute discretion, on the documents to be executed and delivered by Buyer and Existing Lender with respect to the assignment and assumption of the Existing Loan, Buyer shall provide Seller with copies of such documentation and such documentation shall constitute the “Existing Loan Assumption Documents” for purposes of this Agreement. [OPTIONAL TEXT: The Existing Loan Assumption Documents shall provide that Seller and the key principals affiliated with Seller shall have no further liability or obligation with respect to any matter relating to the Existing Loan arising after the Closing (and Buyer will provide replacement key principals reasonably acceptable to Buyer and sufficient for Existing Lender to do so).]
content.caption: Existing Loan Assumption Documents.

content.text: 2.6.5	Reasonable Efforts by Seller and Buyer.  Following delivery of the Buyer Approval Notice, Seller and Buyer shall use reasonable, diligent and good faith efforts to satisfy all conditions to the assignment and assumption of the Existing Loan set forth in the Existing Loan Assumption Documents, which require performance by Seller or Buyer, as soon as reasonably possible.
content.caption: Reasonable Efforts by Seller and Buyer.

section_hierarchy.caption: Reasonable Efforts by Seller and Buyer.

content.text: 2.6.6	Existing Loan Assumption Approval.  The Existing Lender shall be deemed to have approved the assumption of the Existing Loan by Buyer when the Existing Lender has (a) approved in writing the assignment of the Existing Loan to Buyer, (b) agreed with Buyer and Seller on the forms of Existing Loan Assumption Documents, (c) executed and delivered to Buyer all Existing Loan Assumption Documents to be executed by Existing Lender, and (d) all conditions to the assignment and assumption of the Existing Loan (other than conditions requiring performance by Buyer) set forth in the Existing Loan Assumption Documents shall have been satisfied (collectively, “Existing Loan Assumption Approval”).
content.caption: Existing Loan Assumption Approval.

section_hierarchy.caption: Reasonable Efforts by Seller and Buyer.

content.text: 2.6.7	Consequence of Inability to Obtain Existing Loan Assumption Approval.  If despite the parties’ reasonable, diligent and good faith efforts, the parties are unable to obtain the Existing Loan Assumption Approval at least ___ Business Days prior to the Closing Date, then unless the parties otherwise agree in writing, this Agreement shall terminate and the Earnest Money Deposit shall be promptly returned to Buyer.]
content.caption: Consequence of Inability to Obtain Existing Loan Assumption Approval.

section_hierarchy.caption: Reasonable Efforts by Seller and Buyer.
Consequence of Inability to Obtain Existing Loan Assumption Approval.

content.text: 3.	DUE DILIGENCE
content.caption: DUE DILIGENCE

content.text: 3.1	Due Diligence Period.  For the period commencing on the Effective Date and terminating on the Due Diligence Deadline (“Due Diligence Period”), subject to the limitations set forth in Section 3.4 below and elsewhere in this Agreement, Buyer and its employees, agents, contractors, consultants and representatives (“Buyer’s Due Diligence Team”) may conduct its due diligence investigation and feasibility review of the Property (“Due Diligence”).  All Due Diligence shall be at Buyer’s sole cost and expense.  The Due Diligence Deadline and the Due Diligence Period are subject to possible extension as provided in Sections 3.3 and 4.1 below.
content.caption: Due Diligence Period.

content.text: 3.2	Satisfaction or Disapproval of Due Diligence Contingency.  If Buyer decides to proceed with the acquisition of the Property in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, Buyer must give Seller written notice of its waiver or satisfaction of its Due Diligence contingency (“Buyer Approval Notice”) on or before the Due Diligence Deadline, and in such case this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect and the Earnest Money Deposit shall be non-refundable, except as otherwise expressly provided in this Agreement.  If Buyer decides not to proceed with the acquisition of the Property, Buyer may give Seller written notice of its disapproval of its Due Diligence contingency (“Buyer Disapproval Notice”) on or before the Due Diligence Deadline.  If Buyer fails to deliver the Buyer Approval Notice by the Due Diligence Deadline or if Buyer delivers the Buyer Disapproval Notice on or before the Due Diligence Deadline, then this Agreement shall terminate and Escrow Agent shall refund the Earnest Money Deposit to Buyer.  Upon such termination, the parties shall have no further rights or obligations hereunder except for those obligations which expressly survive the termination of this Agreement.
content.caption: Satisfaction or Disapproval of Due Diligence Contingency.

section_hierarchy.caption: Satisfaction or Disapproval of Due Diligence Contingency.

content.text: 3.3	Due Diligence Materials.  By the Due Diligence Items Delivery Date, Seller shall deliver to Buyer or post in an online database maintained by Seller or Seller’s Broker to which Buyer and Buyer’s Due Diligence Team have been given unlimited access prior to the Effective Date (“Data Room”), true, correct and complete copies of all of the items listed on Exhibit C attached hereto (collectively, “Delivered Due Diligence Items”).  If Seller fails to timely deliver or post all Delivered Due Diligence Items, the Due Diligence Deadline shall be extended on a day for day basis for each day of Seller’s delay in delivering or posting the Delivered Due Diligence Items.  In addition, Seller shall make available any other written information concerning the Property, to the extent in Seller’s possession or control, for review at the Property or Seller’s office upon at least 2 Business Days prior written notice from Buyer to Seller (provided that such information shall specifically exclude any appraisals or other valuation analyses, any drafts or versions of reports other than the final version, and any internal reports, analyses, communications or other materials) (the Delivered Due Diligence Items and any other additional information being provided or made available by Seller pursuant to this sentence constituting “Due Diligence Materials”).  As used herein, “Seller’s possession or control” means that information or materials are located in files maintained by Seller or its property manager at the property management office serving the Property or at Seller’s main office.  Any information provided or to be provided by Seller with respect to the Property is solely for Buyer’s convenience and Seller has not made any independent investigation or verification of such information and makes no representations as to the accuracy or completeness of such information (except to the extent expressly provided in Article 5).
content.caption: Due Diligence Materials.

content.text: 3.4	Site Visits and Inspections.
content.caption: Site Visits and Inspections.

content.text: 3.4.1	Prerequisites to Physical Access.  Buyer and Buyer’s Due Diligence Team may request reasonable access to the Property during normal business hours to conduct tours, inspections, examinations, studies, surveys, measurement or tests (collectively, “Inspections”).  Such requests must be made by email to Seller at least 1 Business Day in advance of when access is requested.  Seller’s approval of such requests shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, Buyer may only conduct invasive Inspections of the Property with Seller’s prior written consent, which consent may be withheld in Seller’s sole discretion.  Buyer and Buyer’s Due Diligence Team shall abide by all reasonable directives of Seller in conducting its Inspections, and Seller shall be entitled to have a representative accompany Buyer and/or Buyer’s Due Diligence Team during any Inspections.
content.caption: Prerequisites to Physical Access.

content.text: 3.4.2	No Disruption of Tenants or Building Operations.  Buyer acknowledges that access to the premises of any tenant under a Lease (“Tenant”) will be governed by the terms of the applicable Lease.  Buyer and Buyer’s Due Diligence Team shall conduct the Inspections in a manner which is not disruptive to Tenants and does not interfere with the normal operation of the Property.
content.caption: No Disruption of Tenants or Building Operations.

section_hierarchy.caption: No Disruption of Tenants or Building Operations.

content.text: 3.4.3 	Indemnification.  Buyer shall indemnify, protect, defend and hold Seller and Seller’s property manager harmless from and against any obligation, liability, claim (including any claim for damage to property or injury to or death of any persons), lien or encumbrance, loss, damage (excluding special, punitive, or consequential damages), cost or expense, including reasonable attorneys’ fees, whether or not legal proceedings are instituted, in any way arising from the Inspections or other  activities by Buyer or Buyer’s Due Diligence Team on or about the Property, except to the extent arising out of (a) the mere discovery of any pre-existing condition at the Property, or (b) the negligence or misconduct of Seller, Seller’s property manager or their agents.  This obligation shall survive termination of this Agreement.
content.caption: Indemnification.

content.text: 3.4.4	Insurance.  Prior to entering the Property and while conducting any Inspections, Buyer and those members of Buyer’s Due Diligence Team entering the Property shall, at no cost or expense to Seller:  (a) procure and maintain commercial general liability (occurrence) insurance in an amount no less than $1,000,000 on commercially reasonable terms adequate to insure against all liability arising out of any entry onto or Inspections of the Property that lists Seller and its property manager as additional insureds; and (b) deliver to Seller prior to entry upon the Property certificates of insurance for Buyer and the applicable members of Buyer’s Due Diligence Team evidencing such required insurance.
content.caption: Insurance.

content.text: 3.4.5	Additional Requirements.  Buyer shall promptly pay when due all costs of all Inspections done with regard to the Property and shall not permit any liens to attach to the Property by reason of the exercise of its rights under this Section 3.  If the transaction contemplated hereby fails to close, Buyer shall restore the Property and Improvements to substantially the same condition in which the same were found before any such entry upon the Property and Inspections were undertaken.  These obligations shall survive termination of this Agreement.
content.caption: Additional Requirements.

content.text: 3.4.6	Effect on Prior Early Access Agreement.  To the extent Seller and Buyer and/or their Affiliates previously executed an early access agreement or similar agreement with respect to the Property (“Prior Early Access Agreement”), the Prior Early Access Agreement is hereby deemed superseded and replaced by this Agreement and the Inspections and all other activities undertaken by Buyer, Buyer’s Affiliates or their employees, agents, contractors, consultants and representatives under such Prior Early Access Agreement shall be deemed governed by this Section 3.4.
content.caption: Effect on Prior Early Access Agreement.

section_hierarchy.caption: Effect on Prior Early Access Agreement.

content.text: 3.5	Tenant Interviews.  Seller shall use good faith, diligent efforts to schedule an interview between Buyer and those Tenant designated by Buyer to be held on mutually-convenient dates within the first 15 days after the Effective Date.
content.caption: Tenant Interviews.

section_hierarchy.caption: Effect on Prior Early Access Agreement.

content.text: [OPTIONAL TEXT: 3.6	Buyer Delivery of Studies and Reports upon Termination.  If this Agreement terminates for any reason other than a Seller default, at Seller’s request, Buyer shall deliver to Seller copies of all studies, reports, plats of surveys, title insurance commitments and other documents and other materials obtained by Buyer in its Due Diligence investigation and Inspections of the Property (excluding any internal reports, analyses or communications), which shall be delivered without representation or warranty by Buyer, express or implied, as to the assignability, content, completeness or accuracy of such materials of any kind whatsoever.]
content.caption: [OPTIONAL TEXT: 3.

section_hierarchy.caption: Effect on Prior Early Access Agreement.

content.text: 4.	TITLE AND SURVEY
content.caption: TITLE AND SURVEY

content.text: 4.1	Title Commitment. Seller shall request Title Company to make available to Buyer in electronic format by no later than the Title Commitment Delivery Date:  (a) a preliminary title report with respect to the Property issued by the Title Company (“Title Commitment”), and (b) the best available copies of all recorded documents referred to on Schedule B of the Title Commitment as exceptions to coverage (“Title Documents”).  If Buyer does not receive the Title Commitment and Title Documents by the Title Commitment Delivery Date, the Due Diligence Deadline Date (as defined in Section 1.4 above) shall be extended on a day for day basis for each day of delay in receiving the Title Commitment and Title Documents.
content.caption: Title Commitment.

content.text: 4.2	Survey.  Within 5 Business Days after the Effective Date, Seller shall deliver to Buyer copies of the most recent existing surveys (if any) of the Property (“Existing Surveys”) in Seller’s possession and control.  Buyer may obtain, at Buyer’s sole option, election and expense, an updated or new as-built survey of the Property (“Updated Survey”) prepared by the surveyor who provided the Existing Surveys or another surveyor selected by Buyer.
content.caption: Survey.

content.text: 4.3	Title Review.  Buyer shall have the right to object in writing on or before the Title Objection Date to any title matters that affect title to the Property which are disclosed in the Title Commitment (herein collectively called “Exceptions”);[OPTIONAL TEXT: provided, however, Buyer shall not be entitled to object to the Existing Loan so long as the Existing Lender has given or is in the process of giving an Existing Loan Assumption Approval]. Unless Buyer timely objects to the Exceptions in writing or except as further provided below in this Section 4.3, all such Exceptions and any other encumbrances which affect Buyer’s title to the Property set forth in the Title Commitment shall be deemed to be approved by Buyer (“Permitted Exceptions”).  Any Exceptions which are timely objected to by Buyer in writing shall be referred to herein as the “Title Objections”.  No later than the sooner of (a) 5 Business Days after receipt of Buyer’s notice, or (b) 3 Business Days prior to the Due Diligence Deadline, Seller shall notify Buyer in writing of those Title Objections that Seller elects to remove and Seller shall then be contractually obligated under this Agreement to remove those Title Objections on or before Closing.  If Seller does not elect to cure all of the Title Objections and Buyer elects to waive its Due Diligence contingency under Section 3.2, those Title Objections that Seller did not elect to cure shall be deemed to have been approved by Buyer and will thereafter be Permitted Exceptions.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, the following shall not be considered Permitted Exceptions and Seller shall be obligated at Closing to cause the release of (x) any monetary Exceptions created by or through Seller which are secured by the Property[OPTIONAL TEXT: ; provided, however, that Seller shall not be required to cause the release of the Existing Loan so long as the Existing Lender has given or is in the process of giving an Existing Loan Assumption Approval], (y) any exceptions relating to the power, authority or good standing of Seller, and (z) any general exceptions that would be removed through Seller’s execution and delivery of the Owner’s Title Affidavit (as defined in Section 4.5 below).
content.caption: Title Review.

content.text: 4.4	New Title Exceptions.  If the Title Commitment is amended at any time to indicate new or modified Exceptions, Buyer will have until the date that is 5 Business Days following its receipt of the amended Title Commitment and applicable underlying title documents to deliver Buyer’s notice of Title Objections to such new or modified exceptions.  If Buyer disapproves of any such new or modified Exceptions (“New Title Objection”), Seller shall notify Buyer in writing within 5 Business Days after receipt of Buyer’s notice of New Title Objection whether or not Seller elects to remove the same.  If Seller elects to cure the New Title Objection, Seller shall be contractually obligated under this Agreement to remove such New Title Objection on or before Closing.  If Seller does not elect to cure the New Title Objection, then Buyer's sole options shall be either (a) to accept the disapproved New Title Objection as a Permitted Exception, or (b) by written notice to Seller within 5 Business Days of Seller's election of non-removal, to terminate this Agreement, in which case the Earnest Money Deposit shall be returned to Buyer within 2 Business Days after termination.  Buyer's failure to act within 5 Business Days of receipt of Seller's election not to remove a New Title Objection shall be deemed an election under clause (a) to accept the disapproved New Title Objection as a Permitted Exception. To the extent necessary, the Closing Date shall be extended to accommodate the time periods established in this Section 4.4.
content.caption: New Title Exceptions.

content.text: 4.5	Title Policy.  At Closing, Buyer shall be entitled to receive an ALTA Form 2006 Owner’s Policy of Title Insurance with extended coverage dated as of the Closing Date in the amount of the Purchase Price, insuring that fee simple title to the Property is vested in Buyer, subject only to the Permitted Exceptions (“Title Policy”).  Seller shall execute and deliver to the Title Company on or before Closing such affidavits and other documents as the Title Company customarily or reasonably requires to issue extended coverage (“Owner’s Title Affidavit”).
content.caption: Title Policy.

content.text: 5.	SELLER’S REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES
content.caption: SELLER’S REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

content.text: 5.1	Seller’s Representations and Warranties.  Seller represents and warrants to Buyer, as of the Effective Date and as of Closing, the following:
content.caption: Seller’s Representations and Warranties.

content.text: 5.1.1	Status.  Seller is a _________________ duly organized and validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the State of __________________.
content.caption: Status.

content.text: 5.1.2	Authority.  The execution and delivery of this Agreement and the performance of Seller’s obligations hereunder have been or will be duly authorized by all necessary action on the part of Seller and this Agreement constitutes the legal, valid and binding obligation of Seller, subject to equitable principles and principles governing creditors’ rights generally.
content.caption: Authority.

content.text: 5.1.3	Consents.  [OPTIONAL TEXT: Except for the Existing Loan Assumption Approval needed for assumption of the Existing Loan,] No consent, waiver, approval or authorization is required from any person or entity (that has not already been obtained) in connection with the execution and delivery of this Agreement by Seller or the performance by Seller of the transactions contemplated hereby.
content.caption: Consents.

content.text: 5.1.4	Non-Contravention.  The execution and delivery of this Agreement by Seller and the consummation by Seller of the transactions contemplated hereby will not violate any judgment, order, injunction, decree, regulation or ruling of any court or the various state, local and federal governmental agencies having jurisdiction over Seller, the Property or any portion thereof (“Governmental Entity”) or conflict with, result in a breach of, or constitute a default under the organizational documents of Seller, any note or other evidence of indebtedness, any mortgage, deed of trust or indenture, or any lease or other material agreement or instrument to which Seller is a party or by which it is bound.
content.caption: Non-Contravention.

content.text: 5.1.5	Prohibited Persons and Transactions.  Neither Seller nor any of its Affiliates, nor any of its respective partners, members, shareholders or other equity owners, and none of its respective employees, officers, directors, representatives or agents is, nor will they become, a person or entity with whom United States persons or entities are restricted from doing business under regulations of the Office of Foreign Asset Control (“OFAC”) of the Department of the Treasury (including those named on OFAC’s Specially Designated and Blocked Persons List) or under any statute, executive order (including the September 24, 2001, Executive Order Blocking Property and Prohibiting Transactions with Persons Who Commit, Threaten to Commit, or Support Terrorism), or other governmental action and is not and will not engage in any dealings or transactions or be otherwise associated with such persons or entities.
content.caption: Prohibited Persons and Transactions.

content.text: 5.1.6	Bankruptcy.  Seller has not (a) commenced a voluntary case, or had entered against it a petition, for relief under any federal bankruptcy act or any similar petition, order or decree under any federal or state law or statute relative to bankruptcy, insolvency or other relief for debtors, (b) caused, suffered or consented to the appointment of a receiver, trustee, administrator, conservator, liquidator or similar official in any federal, state or foreign judicial or non-judicial proceeding, to hold, administer and/or liquidate all or substantially all of its property, or (c) made an assignment for the benefit of creditors.
content.caption: Bankruptcy.

content.text: 5.1.7	Pending Actions.  Seller is not a party to any action, litigation, suit, arbitration, unsatisfied order or judgment, governmental investigation or pending proceeding that would affect Seller's ability to execute, deliver and perform all of its obligations under this Agreement, and, to the knowledge of Seller, no such matter is threatened against the Property or Seller.
content.caption: Pending Actions.

content.text: 5.1.8	No Violations.  Seller has not received any written notification from any insurance company or any governmental or public authority or agency (a) that the Property is in violation of any applicable fire, health, building, use, occupancy or zoning laws and which violation has not been cured; or (b) that any work is required to be done upon or in connection with the Property, where such work remains outstanding.
content.caption: No Violations.

content.text: 5.1.9	Condemnation.  No condemnation proceedings relating to the Property or its access to or from public streets or utilities are pending against Seller or, to Seller’s knowledge, have been threatened against Seller in writing.
content.caption: Condemnation.

content.text: 5.1.10	Environmental Matters.  Seller has received no written notice from any Governmental Entity or neighboring property owner as to: (a) the existence of any Hazardous Materials on the Property in violation of any Environmental Law; or (b) the current violation of any Environmental Laws with respect to the Property.  As used herein, “Environmental Laws” means all federal, state and local laws, rules, statutes, directives, binding written interpretations, binding written policies, ordinances and regulations relating to the environment issued by any Governmental Entity and in effect as of the date of this Agreement with respect to or which otherwise pertain to or affect the Property or any improvements constructed thereon, or any portion thereof, the use, ownership, occupancy or operation of the Property or any improvements constructed thereon, or any portion thereof, and as the same have been amended, modified or supplemented from time to time prior to the date of this Agreement, including without limitation  the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation and Liability Act of 1980 (42 U.S.C. § 9601 et seq.).  As use herein, “Hazardous Materials” means any pollutants, contaminants, hazardous or toxic substances, materials or wastes (including petroleum, petroleum by-products, radon, asbestos and asbestos containing materials, polychlorinated biphenyls (“PCBs”), PCB-containing equipment, radioactive elements, infectious agents, and urea formaldehyde), as such terms are used in any Environmental Laws (excluding solvents, cleaning fluids and other lawful substances used in the ordinary operation and maintenance of the Property).
content.caption: Environmental Matters.

content.text: 5.1.11	Licenses and Permits.  Seller has provided Buyer with copies of or access to the Licenses and Permits to the extent in Seller’s possession or control.
content.caption: Licenses and Permits.

content.text: 5.1.12	Seller Not a Foreign Person.  Seller is not a foreign person under Section 1445 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (“Code”).
content.caption: Seller Not a Foreign Person.

content.text: 5.1.13	Superior Rights.  No person has any right of first offer or right of first refusal to purchase the Property, or any portion thereof, arising through Seller.
content.caption: Superior Rights.

content.text: 5.1.14	No Rights of Parties in Possession.  As of the Closing Date, there shall be no tenants with a right to possession of any portion of the Property, except for the Tenants under the Leases described on Exhibit J attached hereto or approved by Buyer under Section 7.3.
content.caption: No Rights of Parties in Possession.

section_hierarchy.caption: No Rights of Parties in Possession.

content.text: 5.1.15	Leases.  There are no leases of space in the Property, licenses, or other agreements to occupy or use all or any portion of the Property, which will be in force after the Closing other than the Leases.  Each of the Leases is unmodified except as set forth in the lease documents listed on Exhibit J attached hereto.  All of the Leases are in full force and effect.  There are no uncured landlord defaults or breaches, or to Seller’s knowledge no uncured tenant defaults or breaches, under the Leases.  There are no security deposits under the Leases except as set forth on Exhibit J.  The rent rolls provided to Buyer pursuant to this Agreement (including the rent roll(s) to be provided pursuant to Section 7.4 below) are true, correct and complete in all material respects as of the date thereof and identify all Leases in effect as of the date of the applicable rent roll.
content.caption: Leases.

content.text: 5.1.16	Lease Brokerage. Except as disclosed in Exhibit M attached hereto (“Commission Agreements”), Seller is not a party to any lease brokerage agreements, leasing commission agreements or other agreements providing for payments of any amounts for leasing activities or procuring tenants with respect to the Property or any portion or portions thereof, and, except as may be otherwise provided in Section 7.3 or Exhibit L, all leasing commissions and brokerage fees accrued or due and payable under the Commission Agreements with respect to the Property as of the date hereof have been or shall be paid in full.
content.caption: Lease Brokerage.

content.text: 5.1.17	Contracts.  There are no contracts or other agreements with respect to the Property which will be binding on Buyer after the Closing other than the Leases, the Permitted Exceptions, and the Assumed Contracts.  To Seller’s knowledge, there are no uncured defaults or breaches under the Contracts.
content.caption: Contracts.

content.text: 5.1.18	Employee Matters.  Seller has no employees, and there are no employment agreements, union agreements, benefit agreements, pension plans, or collective bargaining agreements at or otherwise affecting the Property to which Seller is bound which will survive the Closing or for which Buyer will be responsible for or have any obligation or other liability for after the Closing.
content.caption: Employee Matters.

content.text: 5.1.19	No Fraudulent Concealment.  Seller has not knowingly or intentionally withheld or concealed any documents or other information that would make the Due Diligence Materials made available or furnished to Buyer either untrue or misleading in any material manner.  To Seller’s knowledge, the Due Diligence Materials are true and correct in all material respects and do not omit any fact or circumstance necessary to make the statements contained therein not misleading.
content.caption: No Fraudulent Concealment.

content.text: [OPTIONAL TEXT: 5.1.20	Existing Loan. The documents listed on Exhibit N attached hereto constitute all of the material documents and agreements evidencing, securing, governing or otherwise binding Seller with respect to the Existing Loan, and such documents are currently in full force and effect and have not been modified or amended by Seller except as set forth on Exhibit N. Seller has delivered or made available to Buyer or will make available to Buyer a true and correct copy of each of the Existing Loan Documents. Seller is not in material default under the Existing Loan Documents and no event has occurred which, with notice or the passage of time, or both, would constitute a material default by Seller under the Existing Loan Documents.]
content.caption: [OPTIONAL TEXT: 5.

content.text: 5.2	Seller’s Knowledge.  For purposes of this Agreement and any document delivered at Closing, whenever the phrase “to Seller’s knowledge,” or the “knowledge of Seller” or words of similar import are used, such phrase shall mean and be limited to the current actual knowledge of _____________ and ____________ (who are the officers, employees or agents of Seller with the primary responsibility for the matters that are the subject of the representations and warranties contained in this Agreement), without duty of inquiry or imputation of knowledge. Each named individual is acting for and on behalf of Seller and is in no manner expressly or impliedly making any representations or warranties in an individual capacity.
content.caption: Seller’s Knowledge.

content.text: 5.3	Reaffirmation of Representations and Warranties; Effect of Changed Conditions.  Unless Seller gives notice to Buyer of any change in the condition of the Property subsequent to the Effective Date or of any other changed condition that would make any of the representations or warranties in Section 5.1 inaccurate, incomplete or misleading, the foregoing representations and warranties shall be deemed to be reaffirmed at Closing and to be accurate as of the Closing Date.  In the event any of the foregoing Seller’s representations and warranties are no longer accurate, then Buyer may elect to either (i) to terminate this Agreement and receive a full return of the Earnest Money Deposit by giving Seller written notice of such termination within 5 Business Days after Buyer received or delivered notice of such inaccuracy in Seller’s representations and warranties (with the Closing Date extended to accommodate such 5 Business Days period), or (ii) proceed with the Closing of the transaction contemplated hereby with knowledge and acceptance of any facts, conditions or circumstances that render any of the representations and warranties in any material way inaccurate, incomplete, incorrect or misleading, and Seller shall have no liability as a result thereof; provided, however, if such Seller’s representations and warranties are no longer accurate due to reasons or causes within Seller’s control, then, subject to the limitations set forth in Section 5.4 below, Buyer shall have available to it all of the rights and remedies for default and Seller’s breach of its representations and warranties.
content.caption: Reaffirmation of Representations and Warranties; Effect of Changed Conditions.

section_hierarchy.caption: Reaffirmation of Representations and Warranties; Effect of Changed Conditions.

content.text: 5.4	Claims.  Any cause of action with respect to a breach of the representations and warranties set forth herein shall survive for a period of 12 months from the Closing Date, at which time such representations and warranties (and any cause of action resulting from a breach thereof not then in litigation, including indemnification claims) shall terminate.  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement:  (a) Buyer shall not make a claim against Seller for damages for breach or default of any representation or warranty, unless the amount of such claim is reasonably anticipated to exceed $25,000, excluding attorneys’ fees; and (b) under no circumstances shall Seller be liable to Buyer on account of any breach of any representation or warranty in the aggregate in excess of the amount equal to the greater of (i) $1,000,000 and (ii) 5% of the Purchase Price, in each case, excluding attorneys’ fees.
content.caption: Claims.

content.text: 6.	BUYER’S REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES.  Buyer represents and warrants to Seller, as of the Effective Date and as of Closing, the following:
content.caption: BUYER’S REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES.

content.text: 6.1	Status.  Buyer is a limited liability company duly organized and validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the State of Delaware.
content.caption: Status.

content.text: 6.2	Authority.  The execution and delivery of this Agreement and the performance of Buyer’s obligations hereunder have been or, upon delivery of the Buyer Approval Notice, will have been duly authorized by all necessary action on the part of Buyer, and this Agreement constitutes the legal, valid and binding obligation of Buyer, subject to equitable principles and principles governing creditors’ rights generally. Notwithstanding the foregoing, it is acknowledged and agreed that, although Buyer is authorized to enter into this Agreement, Buyer may only be authorized to issue the Buyer Approval Notice and proceed to Closing if and when it receives additional internal authorizations during the Due Diligence Period.  By delivery of the Buyer Approval Notice, Buyer shall be representing and warranting to Seller that it has obtained any and all such additional required internal authorizations to issue the Buyer Approval Notice and proceed to Closing.
content.caption: Authority.

content.text: 6.3	Consents.  Except as noted in Section 6.1.2 above [OPTIONAL TEXT: and except for the Existing Loan Assumption Approval needed for assumption of the Existing Loan], no consent, waiver, approval or authorization is required from any person or entity (that has not already been obtained) in connection with the execution and delivery of this Agreement by Buyer or the performance by Buyer of the transactions contemplated hereby.
content.caption: Consents.

content.text: 6.4	Non-Contravention.  The execution and delivery of this Agreement by Buyer and the consummation by Buyer of the transactions contemplated hereby will not violate any judgment, order, injunction, decree, regulation or ruling of any court or Governmental Entity or conflict with, result in a breach of, or constitute a default under the organizational documents of Buyer, any note or other evidence of indebtedness, any mortgage, deed of trust or indenture, or any lease or other material agreement or instrument to which Buyer is a party or by which it is bound.
content.caption: Non-Contravention.

content.text: 6.5	Prohibited Persons and Transactions.  Neither Buyer nor any of its Affiliates, nor any of their respective partners, members, shareholders or other equity owners, and none of their respective employees, officers, directors, representatives or agents is, nor will they become, a person or entity with whom United States persons or entities are restricted from doing business under regulations of OFAC (including those named on OFAC’s Specially Designated and Blocked Persons List) or under any statute, executive order (including the September 24, 2001, Executive Order Blocking Property and Prohibiting Transactions with Persons Who Commit, Threaten to Commit, or Support Terrorism), or other governmental action and is not and will not engage in any dealings or transactions or be otherwise associated with such persons or entities.
content.caption: Prohibited Persons and Transactions.

content.text: 6.6	Bankruptcy.  Buyer has not (a) commenced a voluntary case, or had entered against it a petition, for relief under any federal bankruptcy act or any similar petition, order or decree under any federal or state law or statute relative to bankruptcy, insolvency or other relief for debtors, (b) caused, suffered or consented to the appointment of a receiver, trustee, administrator, conservator, liquidator or similar official in any federal, state or foreign judicial or non-judicial proceeding, to hold, administer and/or liquidate all or substantially all of its property, or (c) made an assignment for the benefit of creditors.
content.caption: Bankruptcy.

content.text: 7.	LEASES
content.caption: LEASES

content.text: 7.1	Tenant Estoppels.  Seller shall make commercially reasonable efforts to obtain executed estoppel certificates from each of the Tenants in the form attached hereto as Exhibit K (or such other form that complies with the terms of the Tenant’s Lease) and to deliver the executed estoppels to Buyer.  Seller shall deliver drafts of the estoppel certificates to Buyer in electronic format within 10 Business Days after the Effective Date.  Buyer shall be deemed to have approved the draft estoppel certificates unless it objects to specific errors or omissions within 10 Business Days after receipt thereof and provides updated drafts to Seller in electronic format.  Seller shall deliver the approved estoppel certificate to each Tenant.  Each Tenant shall be asked to execute and deliver the estoppel certificate within the time period permitted under its Lease, or if no time period is specified therein, within 10 days.  Within 2 Business Days after receipt of an executed estoppel certificate, Seller shall forward a copy of such estoppel certificate to Buyer.  Provided Seller has complied with the requirements above, Seller shall not be in default if any Tenant does not execute and deliver an estoppel certificate.  Receipt of Conforming Tenant Estoppels (as defined below) from the Major Tenants (plus a sufficient number of other Tenants under Leases so that Buyer receives Conforming Tenant Estoppels for Leases covering at least 80% of the currently leased square footage of the Improvements by no later than the Tenant Estoppel Deadline, shall be a condition precedent to Buyer’s obligation to purchase the Property hereunder.  If an estoppel certificate executed and returned by a Tenant discloses any material matter that is inconsistent with the Due Diligence Materials (including the Leases), or any representations and warranties made by Seller hereunder and Buyer objects to such inconsistent matter, Buyer shall notify Seller of such inconsistent matter within 5 Business Days after receipt of the estoppel and such estoppel shall be deemed a “Nonconforming Tenant Estoppel”.  Each executed tenant estoppel to which Buyer does not timely object shall be deemed a “Conforming Tenant Estoppel”.  Seller shall use good faith, diligent efforts to cause the inconsistent matters disclosed in the Nonconforming Tenant Estoppel to be corrected or deleted prior to Closing, and Seller may postpone Closing up to 14 days to allow Seller to attempt to accomplish such cure.  If Seller is unable to cure such matter prior to Closing, then Seller shall notify Buyer, and Buyer, as its sole remedy therefor, may elect to either: (i) postpone Closing one time for up to 14 days to allow Seller to attempt to accomplish such cure, (ii) terminate this Agreement, in which event the Earnest Money Deposit shall be returned to Buyer and the parties shall have no further rights or obligations under this Agreement (except under those provisions that expressly survive a termination of this Agreement), or (iii) close the transaction regardless of the inconsistent matter(s) disclosed in the Nonconforming Tenant Estoppel(s) (in which case they shall be treated as Conforming Tenant Estoppel(s)) without a reduction in the Purchase Price.  In the event Buyer elects to postpone Closing pursuant to option (i) above and Seller does not accomplish such cure prior to the extended Closing date, Buyer, as its sole remedy therefor, may then elect either option (ii) or option (iii) above.
content.caption: Tenant Estoppels.

content.text: 7.2	Tenant Leases.  Seller shall immediately deliver to Buyer a copy of any correspondence received from any Tenant regarding any claims of default or requests for action by Seller or Seller’s property manager or other non-routine communication with respect to its Lease or premises, or from any tenant prospect or its broker with respect to any vacant space in the Property.  Seller shall not enter into any new leases or amendments to any current Lease nor waive performance of any Tenant’s obligations under its Lease without Buyer’s written consent, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed.  Buyer shall notify Seller in writing of its disapproval with an explanation of its objections thereto set forth in reasonable detail within 5 Business Days of Buyer’s receipt of a copy of the proposed lease or lease modification, or Buyer shall be deemed to have approved the same.  If Closing occurs, Buyer shall bear all Leasing Costs related to any amendments, modifications, extensions, expansions, options or renewals of the Leases in accordance with Section 7.3 and the allocations at Closing shall include an allocation consistent with the foregoing.
content.caption: Tenant Leases.

content.text: 7.3	Treatment of Leasing Costs.
content.caption: Treatment of Leasing Costs.

content.text: 7.3.1	Definition of Leasing Costs. “Leasing Costs” shall mean any out-of-pocket payments required under a Lease to be paid by the landlord thereunder to or for the benefit of the tenant thereunder which is in the nature of a tenant inducement, including specifically, but without limitation, tenant improvement costs, lease buyout payments, and moving, design, and refurbishment costs.
content.caption: Definition of Leasing Costs.

content.text: 7.3.2	 Existing Leasing Costs.  Seller represents and warrants that Exhibit L attached hereto sets forth all Leasing Costs still outstanding under those Leases in effect as of the Effective Date (“Existing Leasing Costs”).  No later than 5 Business Days prior to the Closing Date, Seller shall deliver to Buyer a statement, with reasonable supporting documentation, of the Existing Leasing Costs actually paid by Seller between the Effective Date and the date of delivery of such statement.  At Closing, Buyer shall receive a credit against the Purchase Price in the total amount of the Existing Leasing Costs, as shown on Exhibit L, less those amounts paid by Seller for Existing Leasing Costs through the date of delivery of such statement, and (ii) Buyer shall assume responsibility for paying the remaining Existing Leasing Costs up to the amount of the credit that Buyer received at Closing.
content.caption: Existing Leasing Costs.

content.text: 7.3.3	New Leasing Costs.  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, Buyer shall be responsible for the payment of all Leasing Costs payable for (a) any new Leases entered into after the Due Diligence Deadline that have been approved (or deemed approved) by Buyer, and (b) the renewal, expansion or extension of the Leases existing as of the Due Diligence Deadline and exercised or effected after the Due Diligence Deadline (collectively, “New Leasing Costs”).
content.caption: New Leasing Costs.

content.text: 7.4	Security Deposits and Prepaid Rents.  Buyer shall receive at Closing a credit for all cash security deposits delivered to Seller pursuant to the Leases.  If any security deposit is in the form of a letter of credit that is transferable by its terms, Seller shall deliver to Buyer at Closing the original letter of credit together with any documents required to be executed by Seller in order to transfer the beneficial interest under such letter of credit to Buyer.  If a security deposit in the form of a letter of credit is not transferable by its terms, Seller shall deliver to Buyer at Closing the original letter of credit and shall provide reasonable cooperation to Buyer and the applicable tenant (including after Closing, but without the need for expenditure of funds) to facilitate the reissuance of a new letter of credit to replace the letter of credit previously held by Seller.  Any sums designated as prepaid rent under the Leases shall be credited against the Purchase Price.  Following Closing, Buyer shall be solely responsible for refunding any security deposits and crediting any prepaid rents to the Tenants under the Leases.
content.caption: Security Deposits and Prepaid Rents.

content.text: 7.5	Delinquent Rents.  Buyer shall have no duty to collect delinquent rents for Seller after Closing but shall be required to bill Tenants for delinquent rents in the ordinary course of business for 6 months after Closing.  To the extent Buyer or Seller receives rents (or other tenant charges) on or after the Closing Date, such payments shall be applied (a) first toward the delinquent rent (or other tenant charge) for the actual month in which Closing occurred, (b) second toward the delinquent rent (or other tenant charge) owed to Buyer for its period of ownership and (c) third toward the delinquent rent (or other tenant charge) owed to Seller for its period of ownership. Buyer shall deliver Seller’s share to Seller immediately upon receipt by Buyer and Seller shall deliver Buyer’s share to Buyer immediately upon receipt by Seller, as applicable.  Any post-closing reconciliation payment shall be allocated in accordance with the charges (and in the case of tenant reimbursements, the underlying expenses) in Seller’s and Buyer’s respective periods of ownership.  Subject to Buyer’s right to receive a portion of any funds actually collected, Seller reserves the right to pursue any remedy for damages against any tenant owing delinquent rents and any other amounts to Seller (but shall not be entitled to terminate any Lease or any Tenant’s right to possession).  Buyer shall not be required to litigate or declare a default under any Tenant Lease to facilitate Seller’s collection of delinquent rents.
content.caption: Delinquent Rents.

content.text: 7.6	Updated Rent Roll.  No sooner than 10 Business Days prior to Closing and no later than 5 Business Days prior to Closing, Seller shall deliver to Buyer updated rent roll(s) for the Property substantially in the same form as the rent roll(s) provided as part of the Due Diligence Materials.
content.caption: Updated Rent Roll.

content.text: 7.7	Annual Reconciliation Statement.   Seller agrees to remain responsible for preparing and delivering to Tenants any annual reconciliation or accounting statements for 20__ insurances, taxes and operating expenses that may be required under any of the Leases (“20__ Reconciliation Statements”).  If such 20__ Reconciliation Statements or a subsequent audit discloses that a Tenant overpaid for such items in 20__, Seller shall promptly remit such overpayment to the Tenant.  If such 20__ Reconciliation Statements or a subsequent audit discloses that a Tenant underpaid for such items in 20__, Seller shall have the right to seek payment of such shortfall as if it were delinquent rent under Section 7.5.  To the extent that the landlord is responsible under the Lease for the cost of an audit of 20__ Reconciliation Statements conducted by Tenant, Seller shall pay such audit cost to Tenant.  The provisions of this Section 7.7 shall survive the Closing.
content.caption: Annual Reconciliation Statement.

content.text: [ALTERNATE TEXT:7.7	Additional Rent Reconciliation.   To the extent that any additional rent (including, without limitation, estimated payments for operating expenses and/or real estate taxes) (collectively, “Expenses”) is paid by Tenants to landlord under the Leases based on estimated payments (monthly, quarterly, or otherwise) for which a future reconciliation of actual Expenses to estimated payments is required to be performed at the end of a reconciliation period, Buyer and Seller shall make an adjustment at the Closing for the applicable reconciliation period (or periods, if the Leases do not have a common reconciliation period) based on a comparison of the actual Expenses to the estimated payments at the Closing.  If, as of the Closing, Seller has received additional rent payments in excess of the amount that Tenants will be required to pay, based on the actual Expenses as of the Closing, Buyer shall receive a credit in the amount of such excess.  If, as of the Closing, Seller has received additional rent payments that are less than the amount that Tenants would be required to pay based on the actual Expenses as of the Closing, Buyer shall deliver to Seller the amount of such deficiency within thirty (30) days of the reconciliation pursuant to which the Tenants’ payments of such deficient amounts are received by Buyer.  The provisions of this Section 7.7 shall survive the Closing.]
content.caption: [ALTERNATE TEXT:7.

content.text: 8.	CONTRACTS
content.caption: CONTRACTS

content.text: 8.1	Definition of Contracts.  As used herein, “Contracts” means all currently effective management, leasing, brokerage, maintenance, construction and service contracts and agreements relating to the Property, including all amendments thereto, relating to the ownership, operation and maintenance of the Property, all of which are identified in Exhibit D attached hereto.
content.caption: Definition of Contracts.

content.text: 8.2	Designation of Assumed Contracts.  Buyer shall designate on or before the Due Diligence Deadline which Contracts Buyer elects to assume at Closing (collectively, “Assumed Contracts”).  If Buyer fails to deliver a written notice to Seller identifying any additional Contracts Buyer wishes to assume, then Buyer shall be deemed to have elected to assume none of the Contracts.  On or before Closing, Seller, at Seller’s sole cost and expense, shall terminate any Contracts that are not Assumed Contracts.
content.caption: Designation of Assumed Contracts.

content.text: 8.3	Service Contracts.  Seller shall not enter into any additional service contracts or other similar agreements or amend any of the Assumed Contracts without the prior consent of Buyer, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed; provided, however, Seller may enter into such service contracts and other similar agreements (a) that Seller reasonably determines are appropriate for the continuing operation, maintenance, and repair of the Property, (b) which are cancelable on not more than 30 days’ notice at no cost to Buyer, and (c) as to which all amounts owing thereunder have been or shall be paid by Seller unless they become an Assumed Contract.
content.caption: Service Contracts.

content.text: 9.	MISCELLANEOUS PRE-CLOSING AND POST-CLOSING OBLIGATIONS
content.caption: MISCELLANEOUS PRE-CLOSING AND POST-CLOSING OBLIGATIONS

content.text: 9.1	Maintenance and Operation of Property.  Seller shall maintain and operate the Property in the same manner as prior to the Effective Date pursuant to its normal course of business, subject to reasonable wear and tear and damage or destruction by casualty or other events beyond the control of Seller.  Seller shall maintain in full force and effect its existing insurance coverage with premiums paid through the Closing Date.  Between the Effective Date and the Closing Date, Seller shall notify or shall cause its property manager to notify Buyer of any written notice received by Seller or its property manager of any of the following matters promptly after Seller or its property manager has knowledge of such matter:  notices of default or disputes from any Tenant, notices of disputes involving any Assumed Contract, condemnation, environmental, zoning or other land-use regulation proceedings specifically relating to the Property, notice of any violations of any laws specifically relating to the Property, and any litigation or notice of any claim relating to the Property.
content.caption: Maintenance and Operation of Property.

content.text: 9.2	No Material Changes. Seller shall not make any material alterations to the Property without Buyer’s prior written approval (which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed.
content.caption: No Material Changes.

content.text: 9.3	Seller’s Cooperation with Buyer’s Financing.  At no cost or expense to Seller, Seller shall reasonably cooperate with Buyer’s efforts to obtain financing for its acquisition of the Property.  Such cooperation shall include requesting financial information, estoppel certificates and/or SNDAs from the Tenants, enforcing such requirements for estoppel certificates and SNDAs to the extent the same may be required under the Leases (but without any need to file claims or incur substantial costs), and allowing the lender’s consultants to inspect the Property subject to the terms of Section 3.4 above.  It is understood and agreed, however, that Buyer’s ability to obtain financing for the acquisition of the Property is not a condition to Buyer’s obligation to close on the purchase of the Property hereunder.
content.caption: Seller’s Cooperation with Buyer’s Financing.

content.text: 10.	CLOSING CONDITIONS
content.caption: CLOSING CONDITIONS

content.text: 10.1	Buyer’s Conditions to Close.  Buyer’s obligation to purchase the Property is conditioned upon the satisfaction or waiver of the conditions described below within the time period specified therein.  If any of the conditions described below are not satisfied (or waived in writing by Buyer) prior to the Closing, then Buyer shall be entitled to:  (a) to terminate this Agreement and receive the Earnest Money Deposit, and/or (b) if the condition is not satisfied as a result of a default or breach by Seller, pursue Buyer’s rights and remedies under Section 13.1 below; provided, however, that Buyer shall not terminate this Agreement without giving Seller notice of the failure of such condition and a period of 5 Business Days after delivery of such notice for Seller to cause such condition to be satisfied.
content.caption: Buyer’s Conditions to Close.

content.text: 10.1.1	Seller shall have performed in all material respects all of its covenants in this Agreement, there shall be no material breach of any representations and warranties made by Seller in Article 5, above, and such representations and warranties shall have remained true and correct in all material respects.

content.text: 10.2	Seller’s Conditions to Close.  Seller’s obligation to sell the Property is conditioned upon the satisfaction or waiver of the conditions described below within the time period specified therein.  If any of the conditions described below are not satisfied (or waived in writing by Seller) prior to the Closing, then Seller shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement upon written notice to Buyer; provided, however, that Seller shall not terminate this Agreement without giving Buyer notice of the failure of such condition, and a period of 5 Business Days after delivery of such notice for Buyer to cause such condition to be satisfied.
content.caption: Seller’s Conditions to Close.

content.text: 11.	CLOSING AND ESCROW INSTRUCTIONS
content.caption: CLOSING AND ESCROW INSTRUCTIONS

content.text: 11.1	Closing.  Closing shall take place through escrow at Escrow Agent’s office on the Closing Date (as may be extended).
content.caption: Closing.

content.text: 11.2	Closing Date Extensions.
content.caption: Closing Date Extensions.

content.text: 11.2.1	Mutual One-Business Day Extension Right.  Each of Buyer and Seller shall have the right to extend the Closing Date one time by 1 Business Day by delivering notice on or before the Closing Date of such extension to the other party and authorizing (and in the case of Buyer additionally funding) a $5,000 payment to the other party at Closing through escrow, which amount shall be credited to the other party at Closing and, if paid by Buyer, shall not be considered part of the Earnest Money Deposit or applied to the Purchase Price.
content.caption: Mutual One-Business Day Extension Right.

content.text: 11.2.2 Additional Buyer’s Extension Option.  If, despite Buyer’s diligent and good faith effort to close on the scheduled Closing Date established in Section 1.3 above, as it may have been extended, Buyer requires more time to close, Buyer shall have the right to extend the Closing Date one time for up to 20 Business Days by delivering notice on or before the Closing Date of such extension to Seller and within 2 Business Days after delivering such notice, depositing with Escrow Agent, in cash an amount equal to 50% of the original Earnest Money Deposit, which amount the Escrow Agent will deposit and hold in the same interest bearing account as the Earnest Money Deposit and shall, upon being deposited, constitute part of the Earnest Money Deposit.
content.caption: Additional Buyer’s Extension Option.

content.text: 11.3	Closing Mechanics.  Provided that all funds and documents required under Sections 11.4 and 11.5 below have been deposited into escrow with instructions to handle them in accordance with this Agreement, then no later than 3:00 pm ***INSERT LOCAL TIME*** on the Closing Date (or such later time on the Closing Date if a “special” recording is available and authorized by both Seller and Buyer) (“Deposit Deadline”), (a) Escrow Agent shall (i) cause the Deed to be recorded, (ii) pay to Seller by Federal Reserve wire transfer of immediately available funds to an account designated by Seller, the Purchase Price (subject to adjustments described in Sections 11.7 and 11.8), less any costs or other amounts to be paid by Seller at Closing pursuant to the terms of this Agreement, and (iii) pay all appropriate payees the other costs and amounts to be paid at Closing pursuant to the terms of this Agreement, and (b) Seller will direct the Escrow Agent to pay to the appropriate payees out of the proceeds of Closing payable to Seller, all of those costs and amounts to be paid by Seller at Closing pursuant to the terms of this Agreement.
content.caption: Closing Mechanics.
